intro: Centropogon oaxacanus var. berteroides, commonly known as the Oaxacan bluebells, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
